N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 403.3 - Freedom to accept services

State Regulations
(a) Eligible individuals and families shall
be free to accept or reject services, including those services offered as part
of a protective treatment plan for children and adults in need of protection. In the event an individual or family refuses needed protective services, the
social services district has an obligation to gather relevant data for court
referral if necessary in the case of children, or for making arrangements with
relatives, others and/or the courts to act in behalf of impaired
adults. (b) Acceptance of a service
shall not be a prerequisite for the receipt of any other service or assistance, except for the conditions relating to the work incentive program, a program for
vocational rehabilitation or other approved work program. In such instances the
services unit of the social services district shall immediately notify the
income maintenance unit (or the WIN/SAU unit regarding WIN participant) of the
individual's refusal to accept a service. Notes
